content:
The "Systemic Risk Designation Improvement Act of 2013" amends the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act by revising the table of contents and enhancing the Council's authority. The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act is amended to enhance the authority of the Council in designating certain nonbank financial companies and bank holding companies for enhanced supervision and regulation. The Dodd-Frank Act is amended to give the Council authority to designate bank holding companies for enhanced supervision and regulation based on financial stability risks. The Dodd-Frank Act grants the Council authority to designate bank holding companies for enhanced supervision based on financial stability risks. The Council uses an indicator-based measurement approach to consider factors like size, interconnectedness, substitutes availability, and global activity of the bank holding company. The Dodd-Frank Act grants the Council authority to designate bank holding companies for enhanced supervision based on financial stability risks, considering factors like size, interconnectedness, substitutes availability, global activity, and complexity of the bank holding company. The Dodd-Frank Act grants the Council authority to designate bank holding companies for enhanced supervision based on financial stability risks, considering factors like size, interconnectedness, substitutes availability, global activity, and complexity. Amendments include changes to subsections (e), (f), (g), (h), (i), and (j) regarding the insertion of subsections (a), (b), and (c) and the definition of "bank holding company for which there has been a determination under subsection (c) or nonbank financial company". Amendments to Section 115 of the Dodd-Frank Act include changes to subsections (a) and (b) regarding enhanced supervision of bank holding companies. The amendments involve redefining criteria for designation and differentiation by the Council. In subsection (a), subparagraphs are amended to allow the Council to differentiate. Subsection (b)(3) is also amended to include subsection (c) of section 113. Additionally, reporting requirements under section 116(a) are modified to apply to entities subject to a final determination under section 113. Section 121 is amended to address mitigation measures. The text chunk discusses amendments to the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act related to entities with total consolidated assets of $50,000,000,000 or more. It includes changes to sections 121 and 155 regarding final determinations under section 113. Amendment to the Dodd-Frank Act's Section 155 involves entities subject to final determinations under section 113, removing the threshold of $50,000,000,000 in total consolidated assets. SEC. 4. REVISIONS TO BOARD AUTHORITY. (a) Section 163 of the Dodd-Frank Act is amended to remove the asset threshold and replace it with a final determination under section 113.
(b) Section 164 is amended in a similar manner regarding management interlocks.
(c) Section 165 is amended to remove the asset threshold in subsection (a). Section 165 of the Dodd-Frank Act is amended to remove the asset threshold and replace it with a final determination under section 113. Subsection (a)(2) is also revised, and references to section 113 are expanded to include subsection (c).
